Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘TriStar’ offers a clean, sharp lemon-sorrel flavor with subtle herbal undertones and a crisp, juicy texture. The leaves are triangular, deep burgundy-purple with a lighter central marking, arranged in symmetrical groups of three on slender burgundy stems. The plant grows as a dense, clumping mound 15-20 cm tall and wide, with the characteristic nyctinastic movement (leaf folding) that adds living interest.

2. The Colorful Tangy Accent This oxalis’s vibrant color and bright acidity make it ideal for uses where both visual impact and flavor matter.

  • Salad Brightener: A few leaves scattered through green salads provide dramatic color contrast and a burst of citrusy tang that reduces the need for dressing.
  • Seafood and Avocado Garnish: The perfect accompaniment to rich foods like salmon, scallops, or avocado toast where its color and acidity balance fat content.
  • Cocktail and Beverage Garnish: Used as a stunning rim garnish or floated in drinks where it adds both visual appeal and subtle tartness.
  • Dessert Decoration: The purple leaves and pink flowers create exquisite decorations for cakes and desserts, providing both beauty and a surprising flavor contrast.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘TriStar’ is a moderate but continuous producer when harvested thoughtfully. Pick individual leaves from the outer portion of the plant, taking care not to remove more than one-third of the foliage at once. Supplied as a pre-seeded RFID Seed-Pad Cartridges, it provides a steady yield of 15-25 flavorful leaves per week, with harvests beginning 60 days after planting and continuing year-round in indoor or protected conditions.
